subject: Philosophy
title: What Is Ethics?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on What Is Ethics?.

hook.text: You find a wallet with $500 and an ID inside. Nobody's watching. What should you do?

buildup.text: Ethics is the study of what's right and wrong ‚Äî and more importantly, why.

discovery.text: It's not about following laws. Laws can be unjust. Ethics asks what we ought to do regardless.

twist.text: Different ethical systems give different answers to the same question ‚Äî and all seem reasonable.

climax.text: Ethics doesn't give easy answers. It gives you better questions to ask before you act.

punchline.text: Doing the right thing starts with asking what 'right' means.

quiz.question: How does ethics differ from law?
options: Ethics asks what we ought to do, even if laws disagree
Ethics only applies to religious people
